Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Mold with Six Partitions
Description: A mold with six partitions, it was used to mold clay which was then dried, baked and used for decorative elements on buildings. This type of mold was in use during the Greco-Roman period and later on the Copts used it for the same purpose. Similar molds have been discovered in the area of Al-Tur in Sinai. Most probably the produced shapes were used as decorative elements on buildings.
